parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From kopto; a cut, i.e. toil, literally or figuratively; by implication, pains.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Endurance, steadfastness, patient waiting for. From hupomeno; cheerful endurance, constancy.
And, even, also, namely.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
Perhaps remotely derived from the base of basis; to lift, literally or figuratively.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To try, tempt, test. From peira; to test, i.e. Endeavor, scrutinize, entice, discipline.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
False, deceitful, lying, untrue. From pseudomai; untrue, i.e. Erroneous, deceitful, wicked.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
